title: Use of force data

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Use of force data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the time frame beginning Jan. 1, 2017 to date of this request of Feb. 23, 2022, I am seeking:
Unless otherwise specified, the documents specified below are limited to those created or communicated between Jan. 1, 2017 and the date when this request is fulfilled. Pursuant to the Tennessee Open Records Act, I’m writing to request the following: 

1. Any records documenting the number of times your agency used force against a person aged 17 or under, including date of incident, age, race, gender and type of force.  

2. Any data dictionary that you use to compile use of force data. 

3. Your agency’s blank use of force form used to compile use of force reports.  

4.  Any records documenting the type of call, location and subsequent criminal charges, if any. 

5. Your agency’s use of force policy manual. 

6. The total number of officers in your agency currently who carry Conducted Energy Weapons, such as TASERs, as well as the overall number of officers. 

If you believe that a portion of the information I have requested is exempt from disclosure by express provisions of the law, and if you believe that the public interest in withholding the information clearly outweighs the public interest in disclosure, I request that you identify in writing the harm of release to the public considering the important interest of transparency in government operations, particularly when public funds are involved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

This request is filed by Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Wendy Ruderman.

To Whom It May Concern,
Thank you for your response to my public records request (Tracking #W021258-031422). Your response directed me to the "Reimagining Policing" data set. However, that URL/portal dashboard does not include information that is fully responsive to my request, specifically for a breakdown of Use of Force incidents by date of incident and age. Please see original language of my request here:  "Any records documenting the number of times your agency used force against a person aged 17 or under, including date of incident, age, race, gender and type of force." The time period is from Jan. 1, 2017 to date of request. 
Thank you so much for your time and attention.

title: ShotSpotter policies

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: ShotSpotter policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A map or description of locations for each ShotSpotter deployment area.
2. Any available documentation about the policies or procedures for how and whether the veracity of ShotSpotter alerts is determined.

If any part of this request is denied, please cite the relevant provisions in state law which justify the denial.

If any part of this request is denied, please proceed with the other parts of the request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Josh Chamberlain

title: Adrian Lamo FBI file

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Adrian Lamo FBI file
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of FBI files on Adrian Lamo, a known federal informant, whose death was widely reported in the media on March 14, 2018.

Records relating to or mentioning Adrian Lamo, also known as Adrián Alfonso Lamo Atwood, or Adrián Lamo, or R. Adrián Lamo, or "The Homeless Hacker" (Born February 20, 1981 – Died March 14, 2018). Adrian Lamo was born in Malden, Massachusetts on February 20, 1981 
 and has been reported deceased in Wichita, Kansas on March 14, 2018. Major media outlets across America as of March 14, 2018 have reported his death including The Wichita Eagle: http://www.kansas.com/news/local/article205629184.html and follow up article https://www.kansas.com/latest-news/article210989594.html

Please conduct searches of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the SENTINEL system, FBI email system, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Records System, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, Counter-drug Information Indices System (CIIS), Investigative Data Warehouse (IDW) including but not limited to Investigative Data Warehouse - Secret, IDW-S Core, SPT, and DOCLAB-S, FBI Automated Case Support system (ACS), subset of the Electronic Case File (ECF) system, National Crime Information Center (NCIC), Combined DNA Index System (CODIS),  Integrated Automated Fingerprint Identification System (IAFIS), Interstate Photo System (IPS) and/or Facial Recognition Databases such as those used by FACE (Facial Analysis, Comparison, and Evaluation) specialists, and the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act (FISA) warrant applications and/or Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court (FISC) record filings, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please further consult all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other data sources containing potentially-responsive materials related to Adrian Lamo.

It is my understanding that Mr. Adrian Lamo's DNA is on file in the CODIS database, as well as his fingerprints in the IAFIS database, are held by the FBI due to the very public court battle on the matter as published by Wired in 2007: https://www.wired.com/2007/06/hacker-adrian-l/

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, investigations, inquiries, audio files, photographs or image files, video files, memos, email systems, directives, network packet captures, meeting minute notes, calendar entries, and any other data or data format that is used by the FBI. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, code names, nicknames, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency or any other agency that is known to the FBI. Please additionally include searches for inter-agency or non-agency communications accessible by the FBI about Adrian Lamo.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

It is my understanding that your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, which remain technically under your agency’s control (see 36 CFR 1250.8). Please also conduct a search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for records related to Adrian Lamo.

Furthermore, I request the FOIA log and copies of all other requests for information on Adrian Lamo including the responsive documents.

Mr.  Adrian Lamo was a controversial public figure. This request is a critical part of a journalistic research project which requires the responsive documents for informing the public.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Appelbaum

public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1488234-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

COVID-19 Impact: RIDS resumed full staffing on April 12, 2021.  Commensurate with the return of full staffing levels, RIDS will being increasing its FOIA processing production.  While RIDS will make its best efforts to meet increased production goals, this increased production rate may be negatively impacted by COVID-19 workplace disruptions.  As a result, estimated dates of completion for Freedom of Information Act requests were impacted and you can expect lengthened response timelines.  Please note that these are estimates, and these timelines may change as this national emergency evolves.  The FBI remains committed to fulfilling your FOIPA request in the timeliest manner possible.   Thank you for your patience and understanding.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1488234-000
communications.communication:
Hello,

I am writing to request an update about my FOIA request FOIPA Request No.: 1488234-000 regarding Adrian Lamo. I have not received any documents or any notification since 2021. I did see that recently there have been some limited documents posted on the FBI vault site, I was not sent anything. Furthermore, it appears that most of the responsive documents are more than twenty years old. The documents do not seem to cover substantial events known in public such as a military trial which has long since ended.

Could someone please send me any responsive documents directly?

Thank you for your assistance in this matter.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1488234-000
communications.communication:
Hello,

I am writing in regards to  Freedom of Information Act Request #1488234-000. In yesterday's reply from the FBI, I was informed that there was a letter from the FBI dated November 15, 2021 informing me of something. Unfortunately, it seems that I did not receive any such letter in November of 2021. The last previous communication received regarding this case was on May 17th, 2021 where I was informed: "The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents. You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply."

A record of all of our communications regarding this case is available at the following url: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/adrian-lamo-fbi-file-107317/ 

I have not received any documents directly in response to my request and I request being sent these documents directly as a response that may be examined in the context of my original request. The documents posted to the FBI vault do not appear to cover the full scope of my original request which has been pending for two and a half years.

Could someone involved in this request please resend the letter from November 2021, and additionally send the responsive documents as well?

title: Documents relating to the death and memorialization of David W. Bevan, Darrell A. Eubanks, and John S. Lewis

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Documents relating to the death and memorialization of David W. Bevan, Darrell A. Eubanks, and John S. Lewis
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

I am looking for documents relating to the mission on which David W. Bevan, Darrell A. Eubanks, and John S. Lewis were killed in Laos, 1961, as well as any following documentation relating to the Honor and Merit Awards Board's proceedings regarding the trio's selection for the Memorial Wall.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Adin Dobkin

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York City Department of Correction Social Media
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks records relating to the Facebook page located at https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest. An example of what each of these records look like is attached and available at https://bit.ly/facebookfoia.

In order to access the requested information, you will first need to take the following steps:

1. Log into the page account or a Facebook account with managerial access to the Facebook page. For information on this type of access, see: https://www.facebook.com/help/187316341316631.)
2. "Switch" to the page account. To do so, click your profile photo in the top right, then click "See all profiles", then select the Page you want to switch into. (See the instructions here: https://www.facebook.com/help/123930246348340).
3. Click "Professional dashboard" on the left, or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest/?sk=professional_dashboard

I request the following information:

1. The "Page and Tagging" information. Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=timeline&privacy_source=timeline_gear_menu.

2. The list of blocked users. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block users"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

3. The list of blocked Pages. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block Pages"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

4. The list of "Moderation Assist" criteria. This information is accessible by following either of these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard" and then click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen.
(b) Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist

5. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has certain keywords", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has certain keywords").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has certain keywords"
(d) On the right side of the "Keywords" menu, click the ellipsis menu ("...")
(e) Click "Copy list" from the dropdown menu.
(f) Provide the information from the list.

6. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has specific links", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has specific links").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has links to specific sites."
(d) Provide the information from the "Added sites" list.

7. The list of people with Facebook access. From the "Professional dashboard" page (https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest/?sk=professional_dashboard), click "Page Access" on the left side of the screen. Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=profile_access

8. The list of moderation actions in the Activity log. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard."
(b) Click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist).
(c) Click "Activity log" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest/professional_dashboard/moderation_activity_log).
(c) From the dropdown menu labeled "Visible comments", select "Hidden comments".
(d) Continue scrolling down until the complete list is loaded.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Request FOIL-2023-072-00116 Submitted to Department of Correction (DOC)
communications.communication:
Your request FOIL-2023-072-00116 has been successfully submitted to the Department of Correction (DOC).
                                The details of your request are shown below. 
 
Request Title: New York City Department of Correction Social Media 
 
Request Description: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks records relating to the Facebook page located at https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest. An example of what each of these records look like is attached and available at https://bit.ly/facebookfoia.

In order to access the requested information, you will first need to take the following steps:

1. Log into the page account or a Facebook account with managerial access to the Facebook page. For information on this type of access, see: https://www.facebook.com/help/187316341316631.)
2. "Switch" to the page account. To do so, click your profile photo in the top right, then click "See all profiles", then select the Page you want to switch into. (See the instructions here: https://www.facebook.com/help/123930246348340).
3. Click "Professional dashboard" on the left, or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest/?sk=professional_dashboard

I request the following information:

1. The "Page and Tagging" information. Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=timeline&privacy_source=timeline_gear_menu.

2. The list of blocked users. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block users"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

3. The list of blocked Pages. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block Pages"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

4. The list of "Moderation Assist" criteria. This information is accessible by following either of these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard" and then click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen.
(b) Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist

5. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has certain keywords", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has certain keywords").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has certain keywords"
(d) On the right side of the "Keywords" menu, click the ellipsis menu ("...")
(e) Click "Copy list" from the dropdown menu.
(f) Provide the information from the list.

6. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has specific links", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has specific links").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has links to specific sites."
(d) Provide the information from the "Added sites" list.

7. The list of people with Facebook access. From the "Professional dashboard" page (https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest/?sk=professional_dashboard), click "Page Access" on the left side of the screen. Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=profile_access

8. The list of moderation actions in the Activity log. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard."
(b) Click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist).
(c) Click "Activity log" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/jointheboldest/professional_dashboard/moderation_activity_log).
(c) From the dropdown menu labeled "Visible comments", select "Hidden comments".
(d) Continue scrolling down until the complete list is loaded.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

Attachments:

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/adamsteinbaugh/119217/Facebook_FOIA_Guide_New_Page_Experience.pdf 
 
Attached File: Facebook_FOIA_Guide_New_Page_Experience.pdf: Facebook_FOIA_Guide_New_Page_Experience.pdf (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/response/2720712) 
 
 
Requester's Contact Information

 Not provided

 Not provided

  142342-58250496@requests.muckrock.com (mailto:142342-58250496@requests.muckrock.com)

title: Photos of the President with cake (George W Bush (43) Presidential Library)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Photos of the President with cake (George W Bush (43) Presidential Library)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

All photographs either taken by White House photographers or otherwise held by the Library which include or feature the president and a cake, birthday or otherwise.

I am journalist who writes extensively about FBI files - https://www.muckrock.com/project/subjects-matter-fbi-files-10/, which have received national and international attention - http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3219376/Undercover-FBI-agents-spy-annual-Burning-Man-festival-light-ongoing-war-terrorism-use-test-new-intelligence-collection-technology.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

JPat Brown

title: Gov. Ron DeSantis' Calendar

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Gov. Ron DeSantis' Calendar
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

The calendar of Gov. Ron DeSantis from Jan. 9, 2019 to present date. I request that the records be released in electronic format, preferably as an export from Microsoft Outlook or whatever similar software is used by the office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Gov. Ron DeSantis' Calendar
communications.communication:
Good morning,

The Governor’s Office of Open Government is in receipt of your request for records as stated in your email below. If there is a fee associated with your request, you will be provided with a fee estimate for your review. Thank you for contacting the Executive Office of the Governor.

Sincerely,
Office of Open Government

files.title: ~WRD0000
files.source: Executive Office of the Governor of Florida, Florida

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Gov. Ron DeSantis' Calendar
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,



The Governor’s Office of Open Government has initiated a search for records responsive to your request, a copy of which is below.



Our initial search has found over 900 items potentially responsive to your request. An item identifies an email, attachment, meeting invitation, etc., and each item could result in multiple pages. All responsive pages require review for exempt and/or confidential information.



The Executive Office of the Governor is committed to public transparency and compliance with Florida’s Sunshine laws, and we will work to process your request as quickly as possible.  As you may know, complex or laborious requests that may require significant staff review or materials costs are subject to service charges.



Please let us know if you would like to limit the scope of your request.  Please note, if we do not hear from you within 30 days, our office will consider your request closed. Should that occur, you would be welcome to re-submit your request at any time.



Sincerely,

Open Government

title: Information regarding Tracey Collins and Eric Adams Communications.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Information regarding Tracey Collins and Eric Adams Communications.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to specific records related to Tracey Collins, Senior Youth Development Director for the New York City Department of Education, who has served as an elementary school principal. I am also requesting any communications related to Eric Adams, the current Mayor of New York City. I am requesting the following records under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL):

All records related to Tracey Collins, including but not limited to:
Employment history with the New York City Department of Education
Performance evaluations
Salary information
Disciplinary actions
Any other personnel records maintained by the New York City Department of Education
Any and all communications related to Eric Adams, including but not limited to:
Emails
Text messages
Memos
Letters
Reports
Any other written or electronic communication
As a member of the public, I have a right to access these records to gain a better understanding of the professional conduct and performance of Ms. Collins and any communications related to the Mayor of New York City.

Please be advised that any attempt to withhold, redact, or destroy information related to this request will result in legal action and complaint. The failure to comply with FOIL is a serious matter and can result in both criminal and civil penalties. Therefore, I strongly urge you to comply with this request in a timely and complete manner.

Last, I would like to bring to your attention the case law supporting my request:

New York Times Co. v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 756 F.3d 100, 117 (2d Cir. 2014) (holding that "the public has a vital interest in information regarding the operations of its government" and that the FOIA "embodies the basic principle that an informed citizenry is essential to democracy").

Matter of John P. v. Whalen, 54 N.Y.2d 89, 96 (1981) (stating that "FOIL expresses this State's strong commitment to open government and public accountability and imposes a broad duty on government to make its records available to the public").

Please note that any attempt to withhold, redact, or destroy information related to this request will result in legal action and complaint.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

files.source: Department of Education, New York City, NY

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #FOIL-2023-040-00186
communications.communication:
Re: FOIL Request Clarification, Reference Number F21,658

Dear Ms. Schatzle,

I am writing to provide clarification for my FOIL request, specifically pertaining to portions five through six of my request. In order to be more specific in my request, I am seeking the following record types related to personnel records:

Performance evaluations
Disciplinary records
Training records
Attendance records
Any correspondence regarding promotions, demotions, or transfers
Regarding the email request, I understand the need for clarification on the different types of email recipients. Please find the definitions for each type below:

Sent mail: Emails sent by the subject employee.
CC (Carbon Copy): Emails where the subject employee is included as a secondary recipient, typically for their information or awareness.
BCC (Blind Carbon Copy): Emails where the subject employee is included as a hidden recipient, usually to maintain their privacy or confidentiality.
Metadata: The data providing information about the emails in question, such as sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and email size.
Please ensure that your search for responsive records includes the above-mentioned email types and associated metadata.

As established in the case law Matter of Data Tree, LLC v. Romaine, 9 NY3d 454 (2007), the courts have determined that email metadata, as a component of electronic records, is subject to disclosure under the Freedom of Information Law.


I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to receiving your response. If you have any questions or require further clarification, please do not hesitate to contact me 

Sincerely

Jordan

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request #PD-1146-2023
communications.communication:
Thank you.

The Georgia Information Sharing and Analysis Center is "a multi-agency task force managed and supervised by the GBI.  GISAC works in cooperation with the Georgia Office of Homeland Security on all issues involving threats of terrorism.  By design, GISAC is co-located with the Federal Bureau of Investigation to enhance information sharing." 

The Georgia Information Sharing and Analysis Center readily partners with other law enforcement agencies to share information and data: "In addition to the GBI and the Georgia Office of Homeland Security, GISAC partners include the Georgia State Patrol, Georgia Department of Corrections, Georgia Association Chiefs of Police, Georgia Sheriff’s Association, Georgia Fire Chief’s Association, Georgia Department of Public Health, and the Georgia Technology Authority.  Federal partners include the Federal Bureau of Investigation, US Department of Homeland Security and U. S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement."

I am requesting documents which detail the agreements to share data and information between the Doraville Police Department and the Georgia Information Sharing and Analysis Center. These agreements could include contracts, MOUs, data sharing agreements, policies, procedures, protocols, or any other documents which describe the agreements and relationships held between the Doraville Police Department and the Georgia Information Sharing and Analysis Center. The agreements may be held with the GBI as the GBI staffs the Georgia Information Sharing and Analysis Center.

communications.subject: Re: [External Sender] RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request #PD-1146-2023
communications.communication: Thank you for clarifying. I will send back to the Police Department for processing. Thank you.

communications.subject: PD-1146-2023
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, 
  
 Our Police Department has researched this to include a search of PD records, inquiries with PD staff, and a call with GBI. We do not have any responsive records to this request regarding contracts, MOUs, etc. We have one PD policy that references GISAC, and it is attached here as the only responsive record we hold for this Open Records Request. 
  
 Respectfully, 
  
 Doraville Records

title: Enrollment Projection Source Data - Live Birth Data, etc. (Berne-knox-westerlo Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Enrollment Projection Source Data - Live Birth Data, etc. (Berne-knox-westerlo Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Live Birth Data including constant birth rate, long term, short term and average birth rates for within the district for current and previous 6 years.

Birth to Kindergarten Survival Ratio used for the past 10 years by year.

Projected Kindergarten Enrollment for the past 10 years by year, and supporting data.

Any communications with NYS DOH or County DOH or other data service provider requesting, receiving or inquiring regarding live birth data, birth to kindergarten survival rate or other statistical data used for projecting enrollment.

Copies of all enrollment projections for the past 6 years and source statistical data, including but not limited to live birth data which were used to provide projected enrollment data upon which securities purchasers rely.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Hacking Team

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Hacking Team
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning Hacking Team, including communications (i.e. emails, memos, letters, etc.) to or from the organization, contracts, bids and invoices to or from the organization, as well as any records relating to the 2015 hack of the organization, the subsequent release of their files and the republication of their emails on the WikiLeaks website.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Hacking Team
communications.communication: I am appealing the rejection in its entirety, as the caselaw establishes that the scope of the FOIA is proper, and agencies are not allowed to claim non-specific, hypothetical FOIA exemptions to general material without attempting to segregate the material nor is the assertion that the documents "would be heavily redacted" a reason to deny the request.

files.title: Admin Burden - FOIA

communications.subject: Hacking Team FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Best,

I'm an attorney with the U.S. Secret Service, and your appeal of the FOIA office's decision regarding your request for records related to The Hacking Team was recently assigned to me. I've review a portion of the records that the agency located in response to your request, and I was hoping we could schedule a quick phone call this week to discuss your appeal. I have a general sense of the email records that we have that mention The Hacking Team, and I'd be happy to describe what I've reviewed so far and hopefully determine which of these records would be useful to you and which would not. That way I could provide you with a smaller quantity of potentially useful records in a shorter period of time.

I should be free any time Wednesday morning, Thursday, or Friday.

Best,
Steve Giballa
Senior Counsel, Cyber Law
United States Secret Service
202-507-1494

All e-mail to/from this account is subject to official review and is for official use only.  Action may be taken in response to any inappropriate use of the Secret Service's e-mail system. This e-mail may contain information that is privileged, law enforcement sensitive, or subject to other disclosure limitations.  Such information is loaned to you and should not be further disseminated without the permission of the Secret Service.  If you have received this e-mail in error, do not keep, use, disclose, or copy it; notify the sender immediately and delete it.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Hacking Team
communications.communication:
I'm happy to discuss it, but I'm afraid we'll have to do it by email. As a general policy, it helps reduce confusion and right now I'm also recovering from surgery and phone calls are a bit more draining than I'd like (plus I'm still on pain killers).

Emma

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Hacking Team
communications.communication:
Hi Emma,

No problem  - I can describe at least the primary question that will help define the set of records that you’re requesting. Our CIO’s search of USSS email records turned up a bit over 30,000 emails that included the phrase “Hacking Team.” From the couple thousand I’ve reviewed so far, most of these are emails from the Hacking Team that appear to have been distributed to a kind of list-serve. Each email is typically a link to a news story about either cybercrime or just a foreign policy/national security story, with some editorializing from David Vincenzetti. We have multiple copies of each of these emails, which appear to have been sent to the list on a daily basis.

So I think the initial question is are you interested in receiving copies of these emails from the Hacking Team? Or would you rather only receive records of emails generated within the USSS that are in some way about the Hacking Team? That second category is going to be much smaller.

I’m happy to answer any follow-up questions about this as well. Hope the recovery is going well.
-Steve

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Hacking Team
communications.communication: You can exclude the ListServ emails.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Hacking Team
communications.communication: Got it, thanks. That will significant cut down on the number of responsive emails. I’ll weed out the list-serve emails and let you know if we’re still looking at thousands or more like hundreds of responsive records.

title: Purchase records and 'less lethal' use records (Humboldt County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Purchase records and 'less lethal' use records (Humboldt County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Purchase records, invoices, procurement documents and other documents sufficient to show any and all disbursement of public funds for the acquisition by your agency since July 1, 2015 of any of the following:
• Firearms of .50 caliber or greater
• Patrol rifles (as commonly denominated for law enforcement use) or assault rifles (as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the California Penal Code)
• Wheeled vehicles that are built or modified to provide ballistic protection to their occupants, such as Bearcats or armored personnel carriers.
• Projectile launch platforms, such as 40mm projectile launchers, "bean bag" or specialty impact munition ("SIM") weapons, and "riot guns" used to disperse chemical agents
• Long-Range Acoustic Device (LRAD)

2. Purchase records, invoices, procurement documents and other documents sufficient to show any and all disbursement of public funds for the acquisition by your agency since July 1, 2018 of explosives and pyrotechnics, such as "flash bang" grenades and explosive breaching tools, and chemical weapons such as "teargas" and "pepper balls".

3. Records of deployment by your agency since January 1, 2020 of projectile launch platforms, such as 40mm projectile launchers, "bean bag" or specialty impact munition ("SIM") weapons, and "riot guns" used to disperse chemical agents; explosives and pyrotechnics, such as "flashbang" grenades and explosive breaching tools; and chemical weapons such as "teargas" and "pepper balls".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you would like to discuss this request, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, American Friends Service Committee, at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: [Document Released to Requester] Humboldt County public records request #21-798
communications.communication:
Humboldt County ************************************************************************ Hi there A document has been released for record request #21-798 along with the following message: Mr. Lindsay-Poland, The county has located records that are responsive to your request for item 3 “Records of deployment by your agency since January 1, 2020 of projectile launch platforms”, and you can inspect them by logging in to your NextRequest account. The county is still in the process of determining whether the county has any records that are responsive to your request for items 1 and 2, and it will require longer than the statutory 10-day period allows to make this determination. Specifically, your request requires that the county search for and collect records from establishments that are separate from the office processing your request. Therefore, pursuant to Government Code Section 6253(c)(1), the county is extending by 14 days the time period in which it needs to respond.    The county will respond to your request no later than November 1, 2021.   If you have any questions or concerns, please contact me by responding to this message or calling the number below.   Samantha Karges Humboldt County Sheriff’s Office 707-445-7251 * PRA 21798.pdf Document links are valid for one month. After November 18, you will need to sign in to view the document(s). ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Lake Jackson Texas Police - Arrest of Rolando Reyes by Officer Johnny Cagle and Officer Oscar Mendoza - Officer Oscar Mendoza Employee File (Revised)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Please provide any and all documents, files, photographs in the Civil Service File of: Officer Oscar Mendoza.

2) If Lake Jackson Texas is NOT a Civil Service City then please provide any and all documents, files, photographs in the Employee File of: Officer Oscar Mendoza.

Excluded from this request:

a) Confidential information deemed protected by law, statute or Attorney General Ruling.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Stuart Martin

title: Count of City of Chicago employees by Ward and department

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Count of City of Chicago employees by Ward and department
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A count by Ward of home address of all City of Chicago employees (sworn and non-sworn for CPD) by department of employment for the years 2010, 2015, and 2019 (three years, separately). They could have been employed anytime in the year; it does not need to be continuous.

Specifically, for each year, please provide a spreadsheet including data under the following fields (count of employees is grouped by Ward, year, and department):

Ward

Year

Department

Employee_count

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.


Sincerely,

Sandra Tilmon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sandra Tilmon

title: GORA Request: Fusus

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: GORA Request: Fusus
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Fusus.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

In reference to providing the names of locations we have Fusus agreements with, we cannot disclose that information due to the following exemption from the Georgia Records Act. 

Records that reveal the names, home addresses, telephone numbers, security codes, e-mail addresses, or any other data or information developed, collected, or received by counties or municipalities in connection with neighborhood watch or public safety notification programs or with the installation, servicing, maintaining, operating, selling, or leasing of burglar alarm systems, fire alarm systems, or other electronic security systems;

title: Reno Police Department Diversity

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Reno Police Department Diversity
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All policy documents relating to officer diversity training
2. Any budgetary allocation documents regarding officer diversity training
2. Any educational documents or manuals regarding officer diversity training

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dylan Kubeny

Reno Police Department Please note any confidential, proprietary, or protected information will be redacted prior to the release of the records. There could be a charge for copies of public records. If the estimated cost of the copies requested is $25.00 or more, the requester will be required to pay in full prior to reproduction. Materials will be held for 14 days. If not retrieved, the requester will be charged in full for a second reproduction in addition to any unpaid original charges. Advance payment will be forfeited if material is not retrieved. 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the City of Reno Public Records Center.

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request #P047756-101220
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm following up on the following Nevada Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Oct. 12, 2020. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on March 1, 2021. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.  You had assigned it reference number #P047756-101220.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Fwd: Nevada Public Records Act Request #P047756-101220
communications.communication:
Hello,

Our records show that request #P047756-101220 was received on 10/12/2020
and first was responded to on 10/17/2020.  You were notified of a time
extension needed to complete your request, and on 3/01/2021 you were sent
the following close out message:

















*Subject: Police Records :: P047756-101220Body:Dear Dylan ,   The result of
your public records request is available on the City of Reno Public Records
Center. Please click on the link below to access your records: Police
Records - P047756-101220 If you have any additional questions, please feel
free to contact the Reno Police Department Records Division at 775-334-2155
ext. 0. Thank you for contacting the City of Reno. Sincerely, Records
DivisionReno Police Department*

This request was deemed closed *3/01/2021*.

For your convenience I have attached the records that were released to you
on 3/01/2021 to this email.

Should you want to place a new public records requests, please feel free to
do so here: https://reno.streamlinegov.us. The City of Reno switched to new
software in July 2022 and this link will allow you to place new records
requests with the City.

Take care.

CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This e-mail transmission, and any documents, files or previous e-mail messages attached to it may contain confidential information that is also legally privileged. 
If you are not the intended recipient, or a person responsible for delivering it to the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any disclosure, copying, distribution or use of any of the information contained in or attached to this transmission is prohibited. 
If you have received this transmission in error, please immediately notify the sender and immediately destroy the original transmission and its attachments without reading or saving in any manner. Thank you.
